definition: to go on a journey/to leave
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Dianna is leaving for London tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 戴安娜明天将动身去伦敦。

sentences.english: If I had left sooner, I'd have caught the bus.
sentences.chinese: 早点动身，我就赶上巴士了。

sentences.english: Is stuffy voice"H'm" base, chief executive officer's adult helplessly also has to follow to leave.
sentences.chinese: 闷着声“嗯”了下，总裁大人无奈的也只好跟着动身。

sentences.english: I guessed what was happening from a few words she let fall.
sentences.chinese: 我从她说的几句话中猜动身生什么事了。

sentences.english: At this time of my parting, wish me good luck, my friends!
sentences.chinese: 在我动身的时候，祝我吉祥如意吧，我的朋友们。

sentences.english: Before setting out, he went to a different part of the cemetery to be alone.
sentences.chinese: 动身前，狗王去了墓地的不同区域独自沉思。

sentences.english: We got off immediately after breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 早饭后我们立即动身了。

sentences.english: I started as soon as your message got through to me.
sentences.chinese: 我一接到你的口信儿，马上就动身了。

sentences.english: The reason of this sudden removal was soon evident.
sentences.chinese: 他们突然动身前来的原因，是很容易明白的。

sentences.english: We started our trip at dawn in order to get there before noon.
sentences.chinese: 为了在午前到达该处，我们黎明即动身上路。

sentences.english: We shall set out immediately once the matter is settled.
She still showed no signs of moving.
sentences.chinese: 她依旧没有任何要动身的迹象。

sentences.english: Betoe her left to London, Swhichley send me a imagin of herself.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉动身去伦敦前送给我一张她的相片。

sentences.english: If only it clears up, we'll set off.
sentences.chinese: 只要天一放晴，我们就动身。

sentences.english: B hepl your friend clean the bicycle so you can leave early.
sentences.chinese: 为了能早点动身，帮朋友一起擦。

sentences.english: If all is ready, we'd better start for hotel.
sentences.chinese: 如果切都准备好了，我们最好动身在宾馆吧。

definition: to set out on a journey
to return/to go back/to come back
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
the matter should not be delayed/there's no time to lose
to meet/to rendezvous/to merge/to link up/meeting/confluence
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
